title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: The story primarily concerns the young and mysterious millionaire Jay Gatsby and his quixotic passion and obsession with the beautiful former debutante Daisy Buchanan.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: The story takes place during three years (1933–35) of the Great Depression in the fictional "tired old town" of Maycomb, Alabama, the seat of Maycomb County.

author: George Orwell
description: The story takes place in an imagined future, the year 1984, when much of the world has fallen victim to perpetual war, omnipresent government surveillance, historical negationism, and propaganda.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J. D. Salinger
description: The novel details two days in the life of 16-year-old Holden Caulfield after he has been expelled from prep school.

title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
author: J. K. Rowling
description: The story follows Harry Potter, a young orphan boy who discovers his magical heritage and attends Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: The novel follows the character development of Elizabeth Bennet, the dynamic protagonist of the book who learns about the repercussions of hasty judgments and comes to appreciate the difference between superficial goodness and actual goodness.

title: The Da Vinci Code
author: Dan Brown
description: The story follows the investigation of the murder of Jacques Saunière, a curator at the Louvre Museum in Paris.

title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
author: Stieg Larsson
description: The book features many characters, but the protagonist is Mikael Blomkvist, an investigative journalist who has recently been convicted of libel.

title: The Hobbit
author: J. R. R. Tolkien
description: The book is set in a time "Between the Dawn of Færie and the Dominion of Men, and follows the quest of home-loving hobbit Bilbo Baggins to win a share of the treasure guarded by the dragon, Smaug.

title: The Chronicles of Narnia
author: C.S. Lewis
description: A series of seven books that chronicle the adventures of children who enter the magical world of Narnia.

title: The Hunger Games
author: Suzanne Collins
description: In a dystopian future, the Capitol selects a boy and girl from the twelve districts to fight to the death on live television.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A novel set in a futuristic society where people are genetically engineered and conditioned to live in a perfect, utopian society.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A novel that explores the decadence and excess of the Jazz Age in America, as seen through the eyes of narrator Nick Carraway.

title: Animal Farm
author: George Orwell
description: A satirical novella that uses animals to portray the events leading up to the Russian Revolution and Stalinist era of the Soviet Union.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A novel that follows the experiences of teenager Holden Caulfield as he navigates his way through adolescence and society.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A novel that tells the story of Santiago, an Andalusian shepherd boy who dreams of finding a treasure in the Egyptian pyramids.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
description: A novel about a young man named Dorian Gray who sells his soul to preserve his youth and beauty, but soon realizes the terrible price he must pay.

title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
author: Stieg Larsson
description: A crime novel that follows journalist Mikael Blomkvist and hacker Lisbeth Salander as they investigate a decades-old murder mystery.

title: The Sun Also Rises
author: Ernest Hemingway
description: A novel that follows a group of American and British expatriates as they travel from Paris to Pamplona to watch the running of the bulls and experience the excitement of the fiesta.

title: The Bell Jar
author: Sylvia Plath
description: The story of Esther Greenwood, a college student who is battling mental illness in the 1950s. The novel is often regarded as a classic portrayal of depression.

title: Beloved
author: Toni Morrison
description: The story of Sethe, a former slave who is haunted by the memories of her past. Set in the mid-19th century, the novel explores themes of slavery, racism, and the enduring power of family.

title: The Road
author: Cormac McCarthy
description: The story of a man and his son as they travel through a post-apocalyptic world. The novel explores themes of survival, morality, and the relationship between a father and son.

title: The Handmaid's Tale
author: Margaret Atwood
description: Set in a totalitarian society called Gilead, the novel follows Offred, a woman who has been assigned as a handmaid to a high-ranking official. The novel explores themes of oppression, feminism, and the importance of individual freedom.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J R Tolkien
description: LOTR
